intro: Niphobolus christii, commonly known as the Christ's niphobolus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, often with a slight pubescence. Niphobolus christii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
